paper_metadata.title: Social Policy and the Elimination of Extreme Poverty

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: By 2010 some 700 million people had been lifted out of poverty, dropping that rate to 22 percent
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: This chapter argues that, although much progress against extreme poverty in low-and middle-income countries has been accomplished through so-called inclusive growth, the elimination of consumption-based poverty will require greater attention to the political economy of social protection in developing nations.

evidence_citations.target_population_citation: a billion people continue to live below the $1.25-a-day line
